name: The Royal Pacific Hotel & Towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is unbeatable! The price is reasonable compared to the other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Below Average Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a day trip to Macau and all we had to do was go a few floors from the lobby to get to the ferry terminal.
reviews.title: Lovely place, but a bit small room

likes.liked: — The look and feel of the room
likes.disliked: — The room size and was overall not value for money

reviews.text: There is also a movie theater below so you can watch a late night movie without having to walk far back to your hotel.
reviews.title: Just OK

likes.liked: — Service and close to the ferry

reviews.text: However, service was impersonal and the staff were rude. They do not greet the guests when they come in. When they serve you at the restaurant, they act as if they are doing you a great favor.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday hotel

reviews.text: Despite the bad service, I will still stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Just returned on 6th Dec 07. Comfortable stay. Conveniently located within walking distance from Tsim Sha Shui MTR.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: Easily accessible to other attractions. Friendly and approachable hotel staff.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.text: Recommended for family stay. Only could have been better if the T.V programmes include programmes for children eg. Disney channels etc
reviews.title: No regrets

likes.disliked: — Hotel does not locate at main street

reviews.text: It was a very enjoyable stay, near the Cruise Centre and the main Street. The bed was very comfortable and the window had view of the sea. Very good experience!
reviews.title: Liked the location

reviews.text: I and my family stayed in this hotel for 2 nights from 28th Nov to 30th Nov. 07. Contrary to some negative comments , we found there is nothing wrong with the hotel in terms of conditions and locations. I booked 2 rooms and was given one upgraded room at the executive floor overlooking the harbour. The view was nice. Both the rooms I booked are in excellent condition, clean and cosy.
reviews.title: Small rooms but convenient location

reviews.text: We stayed at Royal Pacific Hotel and Towers for two separate nights. Chose the hotel because of its close proximity to the China Ferry Terminal and a free shuttle to Kowloon station for the airport.
reviews.title: Convenient location and reasonable pricing

likes.liked: — Location to China Ferry Terminal and free shuttle to Kowloon Station

reviews.title: We had a great time
reviews.text: Hotel has a convenient location, esp. if you are travelling into cities in China along the Pearl River Delta, and would definitely recommend for value-conscious business travellers, who are not looking for something fanciful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, because it is catered for business travellers, the two floors we have stayed in, stunk of cigarette smoke! Even though we are staying on non-smoking floors!
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Royal Pacific Towers

likes.disliked: — Although the room was very nice. It will be needing an upgrade soon.

reviews.title: Excellent Location, Good Food and Service
reviews.text: The hotel is rather far, by Hong Kong'er's standards, from the subway stations (in between Tsim Sha Shui and Jordan, approx. 15 mins walk). However, considering the price (~630 HKD a night), the distance is reasonable.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and 6 days. It was a brief, but wonderful. The hotel was very nice, and the spectacular views of Victoria Harbour was excellent. Great location. A perfect place for the family. The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed one of our best meals at the Café on the Park. It was close for everything, like ferry terminal, shops and parks. We would definitley recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great Staff at an aging hotel

reviews.text: I stayed by myself in this hotel earlier this year for 5 nights. The package deal with my travel agency included a free upgrade to one better than the cheapest room (I can't remember the name).
reviews.title: Okay if you're willing to put up with dirty conditions

likes.liked: — Location, but hard to go through other buildings to get back to hotel

reviews.title: wrong room??
reviews.text: Anyway, the bathroom was dirty. I would not have used the bath if you had paid me. There was a permanent dirt ring around the interior of the bath, and also several pubic hairs (yes, that's right) inside the bath from previous visitors. The dirt ring and pubic hairs were never cleaned up during my entire stay.

I wanted to use a blanket, so I removed the only one available from a plastic wrap. I thought it was okay at first, until I realized it was choc-full of human head hair. It almost felt like it was woven from human hair! Disgusted, I chucked it back into the closet. I didn't want to request another, for fear it would be the same.
reviews.title: Good for the price

likes.disliked: — Slightly worn at the edges, little bit dark.

reviews.text: Also, once I returned to find my bed had been made as per usual; fine - except that there were two freshly clipped fingernails (complete with black nail polish) sitting in the middle of the bed. What had I done to deserve this, I thought. I am a pretty neat room occupant!
reviews.title: The rooms were not quite as what their website showed...

likes.liked: — that the room size was pretty decent for 3 people to a room.
likes.disliked: — the decor. it needed to updated like the hotel section.

reviews.text: There was also a toothpick on the carpet in the entry, when I arrived on the first day, and rubbish still stuck to the plastic bathroom bin from previous visitors was never removed throughout my entire stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — No much shops in the adjacent shopping mall.

aka: The Royal Pacific Hotel And Towers
description: The Royal Pacific Hotel & Towers in Hong Kong sits uniquely right on the bank of the stunning Victoria Harbour and is the only hotel in Hong Kong to be directly connected to the China-Macau Ferry Terminal. Located on Canton Road, the heart of Tsimshatsui, Kowloon, and with the MTR, Airport Express and Star Ferry just moments away, guests are never far from all the city has to offer: business, entertainment and shopping. Over 700 shops of fashion and flagship stores of international prestigious brands concentrated on Canton Road provide a one-stop pleasurable shopping experience in Hong Kong.The hotel enjoys perfect transportation network to Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, AsiaWorld-Expo, Hong Kong International Airport and a series of shopping and sight-seeing spots in Hong Kong.
